name: Matt St. John
text: Cool!  I get the first review.  You know, most of these places are ran pretty well, being a huge corporation, but I was just VERY impressed with David at this location, and will be coming back here again and giving them first option for my business.  Being smart, kind, efficient, and straight-shooting should be something people can expect from a business, but as most know in this age of millennials who think everything should be handed to them, it is not the case anymore.  If Advance keeps employing men (and women) like David, they will be around for a LONG time....

name: Jason Hubbard
text: These guys are AMAZING! They are extremely knowledgeable about all of the products they sell and the services they offer. I was very surprised at the hometown feel of the shop and the friendliness of everyone there. They are able to take care of any tire needs you have from high performance cars to rock crawling 4 wheel drives. The shop is set up to handle any and all off road performance needs that anyone can have. It is very easy for me to say that after my experience with this wonderful group of gentleman that I will never go anywhere to buy tires again. I was impressed enough with them that my search for a Jeep to build is in high gear now. I'm looking forward to seeing what they can do with it. The best advice I can give to everyone is to check them out for any and all tire needs.

name: Josh Brewer
text: This is the best shop around, I am fairly new to Off-roading and building a vehicle to do it in. Josh, Devin, and Paul have all been extremely helpful and informative. Josh helped figure out what suspension I needed for the future of my build and helped explain the pros and cons and what fits my needs and price ranges. Devon helped out anytime I called to follow up on when parts where coming in along with the progress during the day of install. Paul man this guy is the one you want looking over labor, he is very OCD about getting it right and not cutting corners and has a wealth of knowledge. Additionally all the staff at Elite are very professional and will answer any question you have, if they can’t answer it then they will make sure they get you the answer with some digging. I will maintain being a happy customer with a trusted shop which is hard to find. I can’t wait to do future building with the Elite family! Oh by the way check out all their social media and advertisements they are top notch!

name: Anthony Danshaw
text: Highly recommended! I have had engine work and tires and shocks through them! Great service and advice! Almost anything you want from lights to custom fab work, they got you covered. 100% satisfied with the quality of service and work done!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.

name: G whitts
text: These guys are very transparent and polite. The turn around time was quicker than anticipated. Most importantly, they’re honest and do excellent work. I will not hesitate to use them in the future for vehicle needs and wants.

name: Grant Johnson
text:
Recently bought a new to me Jeep TJ. I couldn’t even drive it home (15 mins away from place of purchase) due to death wobble, loose steering wore out track bar and a laundry list of other issues. I had little to no hope for getting the vehicle street worthy and planned on just keeping it as a dedicated trailer rig. I called Elite and spoke with Josh over the phone, he said they can get it fixed up and back on the road.

They absolutely blew my expectations with the work put in on my jeep. They replaced all heim joints on the steering and track bar as well as completed a full inspection on the vehicle torque checking all nuts and bolts under the vehicle my peace of mind. They even found a few more issues that were fixed in shop for safety reasons on this inspection.

The whole process was seamless from drop off to pickup. Communication was top notch on any issue they ran into along the way. I will absolutely be returning to get my truck leveled with wheels and tires in the near future. Awesome job and awesome company. ⭐️ 12/10stars ⭐️

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review Grant glad we could get your Jeep back drivable!

name: allen holmes
text: Jimmy, Alex, and Josh did an awesome job on my 2013 JK. Thanks and I will be back to get more did soon.

resp.text: Thank you Allen we look forward to working with you more!

name: John DeJarnette
text: Highly recommend!!!  Incredible job done by Elite and their professional and knowledgeable staff. Brought my 2020 TRD Pro up to speed with a 2/1 lift and some 285/70/17 Nitto Ridge Grapplers. Great work done by a great team.  Elite now has my TRD Pro looking like it always should have.

resp.text: Glad we could help you make it happen!

name: Susan Sims
text: The guys at Elite are nice and professional. They answered all my questions on building my Jeep Gladiator and steered me in the right direction for certain parts. And it was completed in 1 day!!! Already planning to return to have more modifications.

name: Randy Reeder
text: Josh and the guys at Elite Offroad were great. Super helpful and very knowledgeable. 10/10 would recommend

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your build!!

name: M O
text: Rip off.. took my Yukon in for an alignment they called and said it was ready. Then told me 119bucks payed they handed me my keys then said oh BTW we couldn't do the alignment it needed new tie rod end inners and ball joints. And said the amount I payed was for the inspection.. I didn't want an inspection but a alignment. So I took the yukon home and replaced all the parts to find out it was fine. Only had alittle play in upper right ball joint the mechanic is a joke only trying to fill his pockets this is why you can't trust auto shops.  Stay away because you are gonna get ripped off!!.  I Am Mike Overton and I Approve This Message!!!

resp.text:
Hey Mike Overton we are sorry you feel this way but we did not perform an alignment due to worn out suspension and steering components. You getting charged was a mistake by your sales person which was corrected and you were given a refund. We pride ourselves in quality work we do not change for a service we cannot perform any other shop would have performed an “Alignment” and not let you know about any front end issues and charged you.

Thanks,
Josh Balch

name: brandon horton
text: Josh and the crew did great work on my Jeep installing some items I needed to get a better ride. Also had a emergency front drive shaft problem and they was able to put the part on the same day and had it in stock. Great group of people

name: Shaun Fassina
text: The guys at Elite went above and beyond helping me get my Gladiator sorted.  It's like all the best guys at different shops decided to go in together and open  the "Elite" shop for off-roading.  They had the best prices, got the work done ahead of schedule and got it done right the very first time.  Extremely helpful and very attentive to what I wanted.  Solid advice, never tried to up sell, and was fast to respond.  Great communication even before I let them know I was going to use them.  Solid group of guys.  I have dealt with a few of the more popular off road shops in town and this was by far my best experience

resp.text: Thank you for the review Shaun we look forward to working with you more!

name: Jamie Carr
text: Josh, Patrick, Alex, and the rest of the crew here do excellent work. From basic to total custom fab. Check them out if you get in the area or online. Prices are great and fair. Local shop, not big box chain that makes you just a number in the cash register.

name: Caleb Clemons
text:
Customer service was excellent, everyone I met actually seemed to take pride in what they do and it especially showed in the work done. Got my truck leveled and labor cost was very competitive and work was done in a timely manner. Highly recommend this place, my five star experience started when they picked up the phone with an optimistic attitude. Hard to find that these day’s.
Thanks guys

name: Kyle Alvis
text: Great guys there! They really helped me decide what suspension I needed to go with to suite my needs. I have since been there multiple times to keep the build going. Their service department is second to none. They will sit and explain all specifications of your build to you. I highly recommend them and send all my friends and family to them for any of their automotive needs.

name: Stephen King
text: They We’re very professional. I dropped my jeep off and within minutes they had it a lift and showed me all of my options. They weren’t high pressure like most of the shops I visited. We went over several options, and I chose the one best for my budget. They were by far the most affordable. I checked all the 4x4 shops in the Birmingham areas and they saved me 20% minimum. I would highly recommend Elite Off-road and Performance. They are miles above the competition!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Stephen we look forward to working with you more.

text: Great experience here.  Josh did a great job getting us exactly what we wanted. High quality work. Will be back.

text: Josh and his crew are great people! Best shop around! They help me out on my personal vehicle as well as my box trucks.

text: Josh has been super helpful and answered all my questions. They have you and your vehicles best interest in all they do. Highly recommend getting the shake down before you purchase any vehicle bc it would’ve saved a few dollars in my situation. I’ll be back for any off road/performance needs. They have solid prices on parts and can usually have it shipped faster than most sites!

text: The guys here are great. My tires were worn out and they took time to ask what I liked and disliked about them and they showed me several options. They explained the differences and the pros and cons of each tire. I made my choice and they rode better than I had hoped for.  I ended up with a set of Procomp Xtreme MT2’s in a 37 and I’m happy. Thanks guys!

text: This was an amazing experience! Rich was a fantastic guide and our driver who picked us up was very friendly, and prompt!! This was an experience I will never forget!

resp.text: Thank you for trusting in us with your jeep Michael.

name: Fred Hinds
text: Very happy with my build.Josh does great work.My Jeep is a 93 YJ.Josh installed new tires and wheels and a 4 inch suspension lift.Upgraded my steering.new rear drive line and new rear axles. He and his guys have done a great job.

name: Clinton Jordan
text: I called about getting an oil leak fixed thought it was 1 issue (expensive) turns out it was something not as bad. along with that they gave my jeep a full check over and found some other issues I was semi aware of but was hesitant to fix in the past. we got that taken care of as well.  All in all I would recommend this shop and its staff everytime. great customer service and amazing turnaround. I had other shops tell me up to 14 days. they had it done in 3.

name: Martha Allred
text: Thank you Josh and the guys at Elite offroad! My husband couldn't be happier with his new brush guard and running boards. Elite Offroad is very knowledgeable and helpful. I highly recommend Elite offroad to anyone I know!

name: Kyle Spena
text: DO NOT DO BUISNESS WITH THESE GUYS! They worked on my car, was there to be gone over, checked over and to fix the leaks, as well as new plugs, new rear end gear, and to address an electrical issue. The car was deilevered to me, and It leaks oil, transmission fluid, rear end fluid, and gas.. the car wont run longer then 5 min or a couple miles without drawing the battery down and dieing.. these guys charged $2,914.90 to fix my car and had it over 4 months..and came out worse then when it went in.. and of course Josh (the owner) doesn't want to stand behind his work, or pay to have it fixed correctly! This guy scammed almost $3,000 is what it boils down to, and had my car over 4 months with every excuse in the world as to why it wasn't done yet.. I do NOT recommend using this place, they are a JOKE!

name: Jeremy Christian
text: Chelsea Wrecker needed some tires mounted on our wrecker and we needed someone to be able to do the job fast and local they met both requirements and went above and beyond to get tow truck back on the road.... the guys are excellent

name: Ken Osvath
text:
Highly recommend.  Thanks once again to Elite Offroad And Performance!  We’ve had great experiences working with Josh and Alex.

Previously EOP had stayed late waiting for a towed Jeep arrival when our son’s track bar mount broke, rendering it un-drivable.

They fixed it in a timely and cost-effective manner, installing a new adjustable track bar and Teraflex front lower adjustable control arms which significantly improved drive quality.

Then recently I swung by and picked up a HIKEit X9 Throttle Controller for my Jeep, from Alex, as a cost-effective performance upgrade.

OMG!  What a difference!   Just as EOP advertised — it’s easy of use, adjustable Throttle Response with 36 settings within its 4-driving modes (Cruise, Sport, Race, Eco/4x4 Crawl) and Auto mode that adjusts dynamically to your driving along with Anti-Theft Password Protected Pedal Lock.   Thanks EOP!

name: Kevin Ingram
text: The guys at Elite Offroad and performance really go the extra mile . I enjoyed meeting them, and i would recommend them for all your offroad needs. Josh and Paul are some really good guys. Glad i got to meet them

resp.text: Thank you for the review Kevin we look forward to doing more buisness with you!

name: John McPheeters
text: The staff was more than helpful getting a competitive quote together for me and offering service above and beyond what I am used to at other shops.  Would highly recommend them for any build or add on for your off-road vehicle!

name: DodgeCummings 04
text: I have done business with Joel Nuss, who is now the full owner of this dealership. It has been an excellent experience. I, being in the same business as he, know without a doubt he is striving to sell great vehicles and do a good business with people. He wants to make his customers happy. We have had behind the scene conversations about this. You can have full confidence in knowing this place will live up to their end of the deal. They tell what they know about the vehicles. They cannot predict the future of how a vehicle performs, but they try to sell good ones and make people happy.

name: Toni Smith
text: Couldn't be happier with our purchase. Always friendly staff and very helpful. Joel goes above and beyond to make sure he has 100% customer satisfaction. I would suggest buying from them for your next purchase!!

text: I've had great experiences with these guys. They will always get my business.Salesman Blake Barrett helped me find the perfect truck for hauling and Hunting.I was about to leave the lot with my new truck and the owner Joel Nuss ran out to thank me and he filled my tank up and bought my family dinner for that night.Such a nice family atmosphere here.I will return and I will send my friends to these guys.Also,THANK YOU FOR SPONSORSHIP FOR THE GOOD HOPE HIGH SCHOOL FISHING TEAM.!!!

name: Coins, Dreams & Crazy Things
text: What an amazing team! As a female shopper I know we can sometimes feel intimidated, or even a bit uncomfortable while car shopping. This was not my experience at all at NAW. These gentlemen were informative, honest and most of all respectful. They worked with me for several days with several vehicles until I found the perfect one for my family and I. They are quick to respond to messages, and have truly gone above and beyond what a car dealership normally would. You can trust these guys to get a great vehicle at a fair price, and most of all customer service that doesn't even compare to others in this industry. Trust Joel, Diane, Luke, Blake , Junior and Tommy! It's amazing how I've been treated by these folks!

name: Jason Clark
text: I drove 4 hours there to go purchase a truck. I asked if anything was wrong with the truck and they assured me there was not a thing wrong with the truck and there’s no dents/scratches in truck. When I get there I see there are scratches and dents. The truck had various amounts of minor problems and head aches. The only reason I bought it was because I had already drove 4 hours. I would not consider this a trust worthy business. “Excellent vehicle all the way around” was the biggest lie I’ve heard..  Enjoying the truck so far because the variety of issues.

name: Cody45551
text: I have been dealing with these guys at North Alabama Wholesale autos for over 10 years now. I have to say they will do things that most car dealers wont. I have never had an issue with buying a vehicle from them. Just good people with big hearts!!! Thanks for all u have done!!

name: Christian Simmons
text: Thank you Guys for the great deal on my ram 3500.I called these guys last week and was coming from Atlanta to buy this truck.I sent in a deposit to hold it and when I finally got there the truck was Detailed full of fuel.Joel Nuss also took care of my motel room and dinner here because it was late and I had worked all day before coming up.Joel and Diane Nuss do a great job here and make you feel at home. Has to be the best experience I’ve ever had buying a truck.You guys go above and beyond.There son Blake took care of me as well.Thanks again guys and I will be sending ALL of my friends your way!

name: Terry Reeves
text: Just bought a 2004 GMC Sierra at a great price! The staff was very friendly and family oriented. I would definitely buy from them again I highly recommend North Alabama Wholesale.

name: Stacy Clark
text:
Offered to buy truck and send nonrefundable deposit and got the runaround.

I've bought multiple vehicles from out of state and a $500 deposit tends to get cooperation  from more reputable dealers.

I then offered to have my bank wire the funds or overnight the check and they wouldn't go for that; keep in mind this was Dec 23rd so getting my credit union to fund same day without wiring instructions for an out of state transaction would not be possible.

Was offered the truck if I could get there, 4 hours away, with full cash payment.

Later that day they raised the price 10%, sounds like the owner messed up on his pricing and wanted to find any way to not honor the price he initially offered me.

After reading these other reviews I think it was for the better.

name: Julie Gay
text:
I recently purchased a Tahoe from North Alabama Wholesale. The salesman was very helpful and nice with the process. I would recommend my friends/family members to purchase a vehicle from them. Joel Nuss and his staff tries to make sure each customer leaves happy with their purchase..
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

What a jerk!!..and they really do sell junk 9 times out of 10

text: Wanna say thanks to everyone at North Alabama Wholesale for helping me in every way possible I've bought 2 trucks in the last 4 months and they went above and beyond to work with me. Super nice people recommend anyone who is looking for a vehicle these are the folks you need to see!!

name: Luke Costello
text: I bought a truck from this dealership and got totally scammed. I bought it from another state and trusted the dealership to be honest and trustworthy and did not receive that. I specifically asked the salesman if there was any rust underneath because i know this years truck is prone to that and he told me no and that it was all clean. I had it shipped to me and when it got here it was COVERED with rust underneath and was even missing parts of the body due to being eaten up by rust. I did not even get the truck of the transport truck and told them to ship it back. I had to eat the shipping costs for going there and back. I have now contacted the dealership and told them I want my money returned. This dealership was a total lie and deceitful transaction.

name: Patty Douthit
text: Loving my Nissan Altima that I purchased from these guys. The family environment was top notch. Will definitely send my friends to buy there vehicles there. The owner Joel Nuss had my car filled up and threw in a warranty on the house!!  Customer service was fantastic

name: Reagan Short
text: One of the workers there, Luke Parker, was extremely helpful to me! I highly recommend that anybody use North Alabama Wholesale. You will be very pleased!

name: Clay Messer
text: I only had about a five minute conversation with the sales guy/owner/worker.  I asked him to send me a few more pictures of the vehicle and he acted like it was too much trouble.  I live about 3 hours away from this dealership and just wanted to see a few more pictures before I drove three hours just to look under the hood of a truck.  I can certainly understand that he gets a lot of "tire kickers" in his business, but I run a small business as well.  I treat every customer with the same amount of respect whether they are purchasing from me or not.  If everything checked out okay, I would have given him cash for the full amount just as soon as I could get up there.  Now, I feel that he doesn't deserve any business whatsoever.  That's just my opinion.

text: Absolutely a great dealership.Owner Carl Nuss and his staff are doing a great job.We love our Tahoe that we purchased.They made everything easy and fast.The customer service couldn't be better.We will send all of our friends and family there to see these guys.Thank y'all again!!! Updated. Done business there for over 20 years and they always kept their word. I don't know if it's a change in ownership or what but that has changed. A month ago there was a vehicle I was very interested in. A week went by and it was still there so I went in with my husband and talked to Joel about it. He said ownership was changing and his dad was going to be leaving and to give him a couple weeks and he would give us an awesome deal on it which was fine because we needed to sell our vehicle to purchase that one. After 2 weeks we had a buyer for ours and was told to call the following week and set up time to do the deal on the vehicle I wanted so bad. Well I called 2 days ago and left message for him and told them it was about the blazer, she said ok he will call you back. Never heard anything. My husband calls up there today and he isn't in so my husband asked if blazer was still there. Guy says no we sold it back last week.😡 Well good damn thing we told guy that was buying ours that we couldn't do deal until the day we was able to get other one. I understand someone could have came and offered more than we was buying it for but Atleast he could have had the decency to call and let us know.

text: BUYER BEWARE. AWFUL BUISNESS. Worst experience trying to buy a car I have EVER had. Had already been to the bank and gotten our loan, got on the phone with them to let them know we were getting the check later that day and coming to get the vehicle, because they told us once we let them know we were approved and coming to get it they would pull it off the lot, lock it up and pull the stickers off but they did nothing but hassle us and rush us and tell us they were running it through the auction that same day then right after let us know that "someone just came in with cash in hand and sold it." DURING THE SAME PHONE CALL, how ironic. My fiancé is on second shift so we were trying to do it as soon as we were able and had time but that wasn't good enough for them. Awful customer service, awful business.

name: Joseph Owen
text: Five star experience all the way around. Should be 10 stars. Truck broke down on the interstate and was able to limp it to the next exit. Called my roadside assistance company and they gave me their number for a tow. Well the issue was, I had a camper in tow. Nancy answered the phone and was immediately willing to help. They came with a tow truck for my truck and a dually for the camper. They towed my truck to their shop and my camper to the campground. Because we were traveling they moved me to the front of the line and Mike and I had spoken on the phone and thank goodness his phone diagnosis was spot on. 2–3 hours later and my truck was fixed. I had already booked the campground for the night, so we stayed. All I can say is they went out of their way to help us out and even offered to take us grocery shopping if we needed to. You just don’t get service like that everywhere and I am truly appreciative for everything they did. Even thought I don’t live in the area, I would highly recommend Mike, Nancy, and the family for great prices and service!!!!

name: Jonathan Pettus
text:
I'm not satisfied because I ordered an alternator on Wednesday around 11am. Was told it would arrive around noon on the next day, Christmas eve day. I called and was told it had not been ordered. I'm a disabled kidney dialysis patient and I depend on this little truck to get me to the dialysis center. I had to re-order the alternator and I have to wait until Monday after Christmas before I can get the truck fixed. This is only the most recent issue from this store I've experienced. Please, can someone hire a more competent employee....  UPDATE ... I called again on Monday after Christmas and was told that they ordered a starter by mistake. I  can not believe the incompetence of the employees here.

It seems that the responder to this post has also failed to pay attention. Is this a company wide incompetence? In the future I would suggest using other automotive parts dealers. No, i have not gotten the alternator yet. But I do hope the other store i ordered from has the correct part. I am planning on picking it up today.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience caused by our Opp location with the ordering of your alternator. It sounds as if they have handled it correctly now but feel free to keep us updated. We will be forwarding your review to the Field Leadership of the store so they can see how their customers feel about the service provided and address it as needed. We hope to see you return and thank you for choosing Advance.

name: Brandon Thomas
text:
After speaking with our local Line-X store owners (whom we would never do business with) within our area and doing extensive research on how it is Suppose to be done and after contacting Line X of Huntsville to verify the TRUE Line-X way. We decide to take a 4 hour road trip to Huntsville Alabama to get our truck bed sprayed!

The amount of customer service and amazing workmanship we received here was the BEST we have ever received from a company. They reassured us that our long journey to them would not be one we regret but full of great memories. We have nothing but positive things to say about this corporate Line-X store.

Considering we were not planning on staying in Huntsville they was able to get our truck in and out within the same amount of time it took us to drive there. :-) Plus provided us with great local tips on places to visit while we waited and even gave us a rad F-150 truck to drive around and told us NOT to worry about the gas!

We were able to get into the actual corporate headquarters (pics weren't really allowed sry) & learned a little about the whole process while we waited on our truck.

Check out the day & sexy night pics below!

We drove 4 hours to get the BEST! We highly recommend them! If we/when we get another truck we will make the journey again to this Line-X because as the saying goes... You Pay For What You Get and why not take the time out and Pay For the BEST!

name: Ian Briggs

text: I brought my vehicle with air conditioning issues (quoted on other places about $850.00 on repairs. They troubleshooted and fixed the issue. Problem was a damaged relay. I highly recommend this shop.

name: Shawn Fowler
text: Heading into Birmingham from out of town,  I had some engine problems.  The staff here were incredible.  They were able to find a part I didn't think was available for my volvo and fixed my car and got me on my way.  They helped me get a rental and kept me in the loop.  The fee was very fair and the work was prompt and perfectly done.  I love these guys.  I wish I had them in Columbus,  Georgia. Thank you for your help.

resp.text: Thanks for the shout-out, Craig, it is highly appreciated! -NAPA

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: These guys are great! I'm always leery of the auto parts place when I'm alone, since I'm a woman and I know some places try to take advantage.  The nice man at Napa listened to the tale of my sketchy car and decided to just test my battery.  When he found that the cable things were loose, but my battery was fine, he tightened them for me and just told me to come back tomorrow if that didn't help.  No Talking down to me or trying to sell me anything.  Perfect experience!

name: Charles Nolan
text: My daughter had a terrible shaking in her steering. Her boss suggested Automasters due to good experiences he has had there. They told her the tire she was driving on was dangerous because it had developed a bulge. They also told her she needed new rear brakes. I'm sure most of you are like me tired of being ripped by dishonest repair places. Well, to my surprise this place was honest, they told her exactly what was wrong, and fixed it right, and they gave me a reasonable price.  I highly recommend Automasters for that reason. Just give them a call, talk to them, I think you will agree. I'm so glad we have the ability to review places now. It feels great to get one that does you wrong, but feels even better to help a company who chooses to treat you right. Thanks to Brooks and the whole gang for taking care of my daughter. I will be back!

What a terrible customer service experience. Is Napa living on the 80's? I have too many choices to do business with a place that doesn't have a better system.

name: Joseph Harrell
text: Hidden costs, last minute fees, incomplete service, and deceptively worded offers are what you will find. What ever the offered price expect to pay 20% more in the end when you shop here.

resp.text:
We are incredibly sorry that you did not receive the highest standard of customer care while dealing with us as a company. We strive to offer excellent customer service in all aspects of the purchasing process. While we do our very best to explain everything in detail, we do understand that from time to time there can be miscommunication between ourselves and the customer, and for this we are sincerely sorry. It is never our intention to mislead anyone in our advertisements and we do apologize that this was the impression that you received while doing business with us.
We would appreciate an opportunity to address your complaints, directly. Please stop in or call our Store Manager, Bill Brownell at (256) 383-2888. We hope to hear from you soon.

text: Best customer service I received in a long time.  My husband's truck had some minor rubbing after we had some wheels/tires installed elsewhere. Appointment was quick within a few days; parts came in on time.  When I dropped the truck off everyone was courteous and very nice.  They called me to keep me updated on the work being done.   When I picked the truck up, the work was explained to me and asked if I had any questions.  I was very pleased with the work and the atmosphere.  I totally recommend H&H and will definitely do more business with them!

name: Brian Cook
text:
A Definite Thumbs Up!

I don't often write reviews, but felt compelled to do so after my recent experience with H&H Home & Truck Accessory Center, here in Montgomery.

I called the store and spoke with Gary, an H&H District Manager. He was very personable on the phone, and after I explained my problem regarding the soft tonneau cover (that I had purchased elsewhere) on my truck, he suggested that I drive down to the store and he would take a look at it.

Upon my arrival, he introduced himself to me, and we walked out to the parking lot so he could inspect the cover. He diagnosed the problem in about a minute, and started repairing it himself right on the spot.

In less than 30 minutes, he had it fixed as new. Then, when I offered to go settle the bill in the office, he refused to take any payment for his efforts. I practically begged him to let me pay something, but he merely asked that I remember them the next time I start thinking about getting a new truck accessory.

This kind of service is rare in today's world, and I can easily recommend H&H Home & Truck Accessory Center in Montgomery.

resp.text: Thank you so much! That's the kind of service we strive for, customer loyalty is our number one goal!

text: These guys are awesome! They have great attitudes and are very easy to work with. I bought a car from them recently and they worked with me in every way possible. I highly recommend Austin & Tommy (the owners). I wouldn't go anywhere else to buy a vehicle, they truly care about their customers. LOVE them!!!!

name: Jodie McKinley
text: As much as I would like to leave more stars for the quick and efficient buying of a truck from Kip, I have to say that TNT sold us a lemon. The truck we bought in November has something wrong with it every week which means my husband is throwing money at parts instead of trying to make the payment. They sold us an expensive extended warranty that we knew nothing about and when the air conditioner went out in the truck, we were told the warranty covers powertrain ONLY. Save time and money and shop elsewhere, There are plenty more reputable dealers around that won't sell you a piece of junk.

name: Clint Chance
text: They welcomed us in with open arms, were more than accommodating. Staff was friendly, however pre-occupied. We bought our vehicle in September. The owner was willing to pay for faulty sensors on the vehicle found at time of purchase. The only major complaint that I have is to Make sure that they complete ALL the paperwork before you leave to help you avoid frequent subsequent trips to sign your name.

text: Absolutely the best in the business!!! We got an excellent deal on our Acadia.  It's fully loaded, excellent condition and we couldn't be happier.  Highly recommended!!

text: I went to 2 of Mobile's highest rated car detailers with my car due to me having sap dried on my paint.  WIth no luck at either of these places I contacted TNT and took the car in and in no time my car was back to looking brand new again!!  I refer this place to anyone now who is looking for someone to detail their vehicle..  Staff could not have been nicer and accommodating!!

Than they told me not to worry about the payments an to use the money to fix it cause they couldn't find the problem. So I found the problem but it was to expensive for me so I told them yesterday that I would catch the payments up today an let them fix it. Than they came got it saying I didnt make payments an told me I was a liar on Facebook. They are very bad people.

name: Andrew Monaghan
text: Hance Auto Parts is my favorite auto parts store.  I am not a professional mechanic but I am learning how to do things I used to pay someone else to do.  Jack and his wife are very gracious, kind, and, best of all, patient!  Just the other day, I had to replace a front drive axle on my wife's Subaru.  They had the part in stock and made sure I had all of the small parts needed to correctly do the job.  Jack even answered some novice questions for me.  It really helped me maintain the confidence I needed to get the job done.  And, in case you are wondering, their prices are in line with everyone else and they can get the parts you need if they do not have them in stock.  They also do machine shop work and Jack has a super cool water jet metal cutting machine in the back that he might show you if you are lucky.  I highly recommend these people and their store.

name: angjminer
text: Thanks to the good folks at Hance auto parts in magnolia springs, I am now finished with a repair that could have easily cost me twice as much on my truck. This may sound like a commercial, but they deserve every bit of praise they get. when you go to Hance for your automotive / machining needs you will never be disappointed. they have been around for as long as I can remember, and the telephone number hasn't changed since I was a teenager. If you work on your own vehicle, and live in the area, this is where you go.

name: Theresa Gaignard
text: Jack was really friendly and kind.  I called him from Boston after the big April 29 storm because I was trying to find someone in the area to tell me what the conditions on the ground were like.  I couldn't get through to my mother, who lives near the Post Office, or through to anyone else in the area, but I kept trying.  I got on Google Maps to see if I could find any local businesses and found Hance Auto Parts.  As chance would have it, they have an extra DSL line, so their phones were still working.  He assured me that the area where my mother lives in Magnolia Springs was fine.  It was so nice to talk to a man with southern charm and kindness.  THANK YOU!!

text: Local auto supply for parts, repairs and custom fabrication. Nice line of parts for automotive, agricultural, and heavy applications, including trucks. Good prices on parts and work. Come see Jack for repairs and fabrication in their full machine shop. If he can't do it (which seems to be rare) he will help you find an answer. They only do limited engine work. Friendly family run business, coffee and doughnuts in the morning. Open till 5:30 PM.

text: Jerrell and his crew at Outlaw Offroad are amazing! They are true and knowledgeable professionals that are fantastic at what they do, and truly care about your vehicle and your goals with it! Couldn't be more pleased with the quality work performed on my Jeep, and you will feel the same. Thanks again Outlaw Offroad, you have earned a returning customer for all my Jeep needs!

text: Drove over 2hrs to let them work on my jeep and couldn't be happier. Did a complete front and rear axle swap,lift and steering.

text: Outlaw Off-road is awesome! We trust their expert knowledge when building our 2021 Jeep Gladiator. If you need any off-road or over landing expedition, go see the Team at Outlaw Off-road.

name: Christopher Freeman
text: Man... these guys are phenomenal. Was driving through by chance, Jeep wondering all over the road when I saw Outlaw Off-road.  I had been to 3 different alignment shops , just to be charged and told “it drives like a Jeep”. I turned it around and went in and talked to the guys.  In 1 hour they did more for me than I got from 3 alignment companies.  A new track bar, and toe adjustment and It was a world of difference. Don’t trust your Jeep to anyone else! Go to Outlaw Off Road!  I’ll drive 45 mins to here every time from now on!   Great Guys, great shop. I highly recommend!

name: Merc doc
text: Super nice folks to deal with. Clean shop and stocked showroom. Locally owned and operated by a vet. You will not regret doing business with them.

name: tamara harris
text: I went to Outlaw Offroad on a recommendation from a friend and I was more than pleased with everything about the experience. I took my Jeep to them for a steering issue and now she drives like a dream! Everyone in the shop was thorough in explaining what I needed part wise and why I needed it. They didn’t treat me like  “a dumb female”! Instead I was treated with respect! The system they use to schedule your service, invoice parts and labor is easy to navigate and it was a nice way to not have to call to find out any sort of status. I would highly recommend them for any of your needs!

name: Brett Pierce
text: Guys are very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Customer satisfaction and product quality is very important. Did a whole motor swap and suspension work done and they did not stop till I was happy with the finish product.

name: Neal Haralson
text: Huge shout out to the team at Outlaw!!!! Chris Sweeney did an amazing job in not only wiring up my Jeep, but corrected wiring mistakes done by a previous shop (not Jeep related). He took the time to ensure everything wasn't just done correctly, but done to where you can't see anything, and I mean ANYTHING - from front to rear on the rig!!! Also really like how they are getting into the overlanding game - some great kit there and looking forward to doing a LOT of business with them in the future!

name: Gary Moore
text: Do great work very busy so plan accordingly, little pricey but I would recommend them there work is top notch !

name: Scott Dinger
text:
If you're into offroad or just wanting that look of a lifted 4x4, this shop is a must go to.
They not only sell lift kits for Jeeps and other offroad capable rigs but also do fabrication.
They have some amazing offroad Jeeps that perform great in the rocks and trails.
So if you're wanting to concur some of those trails that you keep driving past, call them and get your lift, tires, wheels, bumpers and armor, so that you can take the fam and get out and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Megan Warren
text: Outlaw Offroad did a fantastic job installing a full suspension and steering kit on our Jeep Gladiator Rubicon. When you look under our truck you can tell their team pays close attention to detail, takes pride in their work, and are professionals. We will not take our truck anywhere else!

name: Jeff York
text: Great guys that really know what they're doing. I've taken my jeep on for 3 different things now and will definitely be back.

name: Walker Smith
text: Had an issue with my headlights on my Jeep Wrangler. I took it there and in less than 15 minutes they had it figured out and fixed. I definitely recommend this place for any Jeep needs. They were very professional and knowledgeable.

name: Jared Boyd
text: Knowledgeable, Good Parts, And Good Work. The staff is great. Chris Sweeney has got to be one of the best Jeep techs I've ever met. If you're looking for somewhere that you can trust with your rig, this is the place.

name: Julie Haralson
text: Amazing attention to detail! Friendly and professional service. Takes the time to ensure work is done to your satisfaction and explains everything. Price is very reasonable. Can't say enough good about Outlaw - highly recommend!!!!

resp.text: Thank you Neil!

name: Jamie Thomas
text:
Best place in North Alabama and Southern Tennessee to take any off road vehicle for all repairs or modifications. Period.
Owner is knowledgeable, and fair in his pricing. He is truly after his customer’s satisfaction and it is obvious, he will not sleep at night until you do. Can’t begin to brag enough about this company.
Top notch. Every. Single. Time.

resp.text: Thank you Jamie! It's been a pleasure working with you every single time! Look forward to working with you more in the future!

name: Scotty Lovelady
text: Extremely knowledgeable staff! Top quality work!

name: Darb Whitfield
text: I have worked with this company on a very large project and have been impressed from day one. From the way I was treated as a new customer to the complete buying experience. We are picking up our Jeep soon and can’t wait!

name: Scott Williams
text:
Why use Outlaw Offroad for any of your 4x4 needs? I would have to ask you why not?

Thus far I have purchased Yeti steersmarts, Rock Krawler X-Factor Longarm, Fox 2.5 Coilovers, PSC Steering system, RockHard roll cage, Adams 1350 Drive shafts (front and rear), RCV fron axle shafts, Yukon chromoly rear axles shafts and EVO front truss. All pricing beat or at least matched online prices and had everything in hand in same week.

I installed some things myself, but Outlaw Offroad installed the front truss and Rock Krawler X-Factor Longarm. While doing so, they corrected my alignment of the PSC RAM, fixed some wiring to my rear ABS Sensors (at no cost, they just wanted it right for me).

At my request we split the Longarm install, did the front in December and did the rear just yesterday (3/13/20) and let me tell you, knowing I was trying to get it ready for MOAB trip, they got my jeep in and out the same day, even while doing the extra things I mentioned above and even though they, themselves are in EJS crunch time. They stayed late till 10pm to take care of me, no they didn't have to, they did it cause they wanted too and wanted to make me happy. They did that, cause they are jeepers too and know what it is like to want to get your vehicle back to you and you enjoy the new upgrades, they did that because that is just who they are and how they are.

So I ask again......Why not use Outlaw Offroad for any and all of your 4x4 needs??? They are quite simply....the best.

name: Amanda Crane
text: Very friendly and knowledgeable guys.  Highly recommend them for any of your offroad needs.

name: Lisa Mount
text: Awesome shop. Installed my lift...fast, knowledgeable and professional. Ordered other parts from them too..fast shipping. Stopped by the shop today cause I had lost my sway bar link disconnect bolt and they had me fixed up and back on my way on minutes. They got you covered  from  the  little jobs to the big ones.

resp.text: Thank you Lisa! you know you can always count on us!

name: Anna Chancellor
text: These guys are great.  Very knowledgeable and friendly.  Installed wheel spacers for us right before they closed.  We'll definitely take future Jeep work here.  Highly recommend them to anyone that appreciates good service.

resp.text: Thank you Anna!

name: Matt Cross
text: They quickly diagnosed and repaired the issue with the 4 wheel drive on my jeep.  Honest with very fair prices and top quality work.  Highly recommend!

name: Brett Cole
text: Unorganized, incompetent, just about does it!!

name: Eric Taylor
text: Each time I have been to Outlaw Offroad to discuss upgrades to my Jeep, they have been the best. Whether I brought my own parts or order the parts through them. Installation has been top notch, as has been the customer service. I highly recommend Outlaw Offroad for any work needed for you Jeep.

resp.text: Eric, its been great working with you as we sort everything out on your JK to make it right and safe for you!

name: George Anthony III
text: The crew at Outlaw Offroad provided excellent service from beginning to end. I had spoke with Jerrell Reynolds to begin with about doing a lift along with wheels and tires on my 2015 Jeep Rubicon Unlimited. From there I stopped in at the shop and spoke with Chris Sweeney about various options. He welcomed me in like I was long lost family. He showed me a rig they were currently working on, as well as a performance of the shocks I was currently looking at getting. From there I ordered what I wanted through the shop. They worked within my budget and made it work for me. Never once felt pressured to do anything I didn’t want to do. They’re all very knowledgeable about the work they do. We ordered the parts on Friday and the following Wednesday I was getting called to come in early for the work. They knocked out everything in one afternoon. To top it all off, due to being at work I couldn’t pick it up during their office hours, so they went above and beyond and dropped my Jeep off at my house. Been super pleased with every single aspect of their business. If you’re looking for a offroad shop full of professionals who love and care about what they do give this shop your first look.

name: Randall Munger
text: Needed some welding done after a new suspension install and team at Outlaw Off-roadquickly fit me in and delivered a great job. On top of doing what I asked for they also looked at my install to identify a minor tweaks that I need to do as a result of the lift. Great shop with a staff who wheel and know what a Jeep needs. Give these guys a shot, they won’t disappoint.

name: Jason Powell
text: Jerrel Reynolds got me parts that I couldn't find from any other distributor in two days.  The manufacturer was saying 20+ days at the time.  They were super helpful.  :)

name: Andrew Sharp
text: The group of guys are helpful and very knowledgeable. They are willing to help and got my jeep fixed quickly. I will utilize them for all my upgrade and repair needs.

name: J. Suit
text: I couldn't have received a better word of mouth recommendation from fellow Jeepers in North Alabama. The staff was fantastic answering my questions and I am a newbie, so I had lots of questions. They even gave me the hookup...literally 😃 I would highly recommend you take all of your offroading customization needs to Outlaw Offroads. You will get educated by the Superior Staff, you will receive Superior Work, and Superior Service for an affordable price.

name: Chase Burnett Fishing
text: Great people to work with and amazing work, they added a teraflex 2.5” lift with falcon shocks, method wheels and 35” Nitto trail grapplers, and the iDrive throttle controller..... my Jeep now drives better and performs better than it did before. Truly incredible. They also took the time to go on a test ride with me and tell me several tips and tricks to keeping everything in good shape and rolling smoothly. Very happy with my experience

name: Daniel Childers
text: The guys at Outlaw Offroad - Alabama are awesome. They were able to look at my Jeep and figure out my DEATH WABBLE problem as soon as I pulled up on a random day and get parts ordered. When I dropped it off they they got right to work on it and were very transparent on what they were doing to the Jeep and any problems that popped up. They have pride in there work. I can say in all honesty that they are the only shop that will ever touch any of my jeeps.

resp.text: Thank you Daniel!

name: tara padilla
text: Great customer service and their knowledge is outstanding

name: Darrel K
text:
Great Service by two guys (the owner and Chris).  I followed a friend to the Outlaw Off-road and 4X4 Inc.. shop so he could drop off his Jeep to have a winch installed.    While on the way there and about 2 blocks from the shop, my 1998 TJ went down.   My friend went into the shop and they provided him with a tow strap to get me to the shop.   Once there the owner Jerrell immediately attempted to assess the problem.
He then went to Chris (who specializes in TJ’s) and who at the time was working on another Jeep.  Chris advises him to connect the computer to my Jeep and look for a Crank Position Sensor failure based on the information provided.  That was exactly what was wrong.  Jerrell called and had the part there in 20 minutes and about the time Chris had completed the work on the other Jeep.  Chris immediately worked to install the part and was done in about 15 minutes.   The cost was extremely reasonable.   It may be a long drive for me, but I will not take my Jeep to another place.

The same thing happened last week with my Jeep and I was charged an excessive amount for what I was told was an alternator ground wire fault.

Thanks Jerrell and Chris for getting me back on the road again and Turing that part of my day around.

name: Jack Cunningham
text: Great work, I brought my JKU in because it had a slight wobble and I was getting a metal scraping from the back brakes.  Outlaw found the problem, fixed it and the Jeep has never drove better. Was very fair on pricing also.

name: deuces Wilde
text: Jerrel and his crew are hands down the best shop in the South to take your Jeep. I blew up my transmission Sunday and it was back on the road Tuesday. Fantastic shop with great rates. Jerrel even stopped on the side of the road to check on me when he saw our group pulled over. Top class service.

name: Gardner Gann
text: Jerrel and his crew did a fantastic job installing the lift on my Jeep while also being very friendly!

name: Jeff Quade
text: Amazing fast parts, at great prices. Very responsive communication! They did my axle swap on my JL and got both front and rear done in one day. Amazing work and no problems after the install.

resp.text: Jeff, your job was a tough one given the time frame, but we got it done! let us know if we can ever be of assistance in the future!

text: Great local place to get Jeep parts, ask advice and have work done. Everyone there is knowledgeable about Jeep mods and have a friendly attitude.

text: Quick quote with easy options to pay. Parts came in as requested and on time. Would purchase from them again with out a doubt. Would absolutely recommend!

name: Gerald Smith
text: I went to Landers this morning for alignment. They wouldn't do it and said the trac bar was bad.  I had spent 2 hours there and they wanted just over $400 to fix it.  I decided to go check out Outlaw Off-road. The owner climbed under my Jeep and checked a few things out. Come to find out I was missing nut on the rear lower control arm and then they went through and tightened up everything for me.  I’d like to give a HUGE SHOUT out to the Outlaw Off-road crew.  Thank you for taking the time to check everything out for me.  I greatly appreciate it!

name: David Brock
text: Jerrell and his team of Jeep experts and owners  did an outstanding job of recommending the right set up for my new Jeep Rubicon, ordering and installing the parts and recommending other upgrades to consider.  Great group of experts and genuinely good guys!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Brock! We really enjoyed working on your Rubicon for you and getting you set up with the right parts that work best for your goals!

text: So far I have purchased a Steer Smart Yeti Xd steering upgrade and the Rock Krawler Adventure Series stage 2 3.5” lift. name: Shannon Amos
text: Very knowledgeable!! Awesome people!

text: My experience at Outlaw Off-road was excellent. They were great to work with and very patient while I made decisions on what parts I wanted. I was able to get all of the features I wanted within the budget I had. I definitely recommend the Steersmarts Yeti XD set up and very happy with the Teraflex lift. This is a great shop that I will definitely recommend and do business with again. Thanks you guys!

resp.text: Thank you Eric! It was a pleasure serving you and we look forward to working with you again in the future!

text: I just had my baby boy Jeep built by Outlaw! Omg I am dying over what Jerrell, Chris, and the guys did you it. It is amazing and my husband is so jelly lolololol

name: Andy Palys
text:
I went to Outlaw Offroad, because I know and trust the owner, Jerrell Reynolds. I knew my Jeep would be in good hands, because the entire staff are Jeepers too! In addition to doing the work I went in for (Metal Cloak 3.5” lift, Rock Krawler control arms, Steer Smarts front track bar, Tom Woods front drive shaft), the staff found several errors another shop left me with, all unknown to me! My Jeep was a danger to drive, and I never knew. Outlaw fixed everything that was wrong and did a thorough check of my entire setup. Their attention to detail is like nothing I’ve ever experienced before. Now my Jeep drives better than it ever did, and it’s finally safe! I’m beyond pleased with my Outlaw experience. I’ll never let another shop touch my Jeep! I’m forever part of the Outlaw Nation now!

Thanks Jerrell, Chris, and Sam for your hard work on my Jeep. You guys rock!

resp.text: Andy, Man i dont even know what to say other then im glad we caught your issues and fixed it the right way before your jeep burned to the ground. We are still in shock as to what was done to your beautiful JLUR. Rest easy friend and know its right now!

name: Joel Hamm
text:
Awesome service!
Great guys!!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Hamm!

name: Cale Lockhart
text: Take your car and money somewhere else, like Green Garage. TAPCO kept my car for over a week while making no attempts to contact and update me on the repair details. I had to call them daily. They did not give me an estimate for the repair and I was stuck with a $200 bill after paying them $300 the week prior. I went in for a new belt and to look at an oil leak and $500 later and my oil light is still on. Also they misgendered me (transman) the entire transaction. Very cool. Also your car will be sitting outside unlocked after they have worked on it.

resp.text: Cale, I apologize that you felt mistreated. You brought the vehicle in for the oil leak and we found your axle seal to be leaking. This is on the transmission side of your vehicle. The seal was replaced and you also requested a new drive belt which we happily installed for you. I advised you that there may be further oil leaks, and we would need to keep an eye on it and to bring it back in if oil was still visibly leaking on the ground. You had the vehicle towed in for a no start issue. After 3 hours of diagnosis not charged to you, we found that there was an ECM update needed for the vehicle. This is not a service we provide, and I know the advisor informed you that we were waiting on the programmer to come and flash the ECM. The advisor should of given you a rough estimate of cost for this service and I apologize he did not. We also did not know what the cost would be for the service because it has ranged from $45.00 to $400 in the past. So as we knew the fix, the cost was out of our hands. Once the programmer arrived, he performed the flash on the ECM, the vehicle cranked, and he gave me a bill for $200. We called you, let you know the vehicle was repaired and the cost was $200. We literally did not make one dime off of you, and spent 3 hours of diagnosing to confirm we had the right fix for you ( Normally a $345 cost). If your oil light is still on, then you may have another oil leak on the engine side and would need to address that issue, just as I advised you personally. As far as misgendering, we apologize, not really sure what else to say. We will do better with that situation as a whole. We apologize again for the way you feel. We were just doing our best to get your vehicle back in your hands, at the cheapest cost possible. We are not magicians, nor fortune tellers. We do not control when a vehicle breaks, or what mechanical part may fail and start leaking. All we do is advise the best path forward with as much information as we have to give the customer the best chance to make the right decision for themselves. Thank you for business. Please let us know if we can further assist you with your cars in the future.

name: Mark Paxton
text: I had an excellent experience with TAPCO on a '96 FZJ80 restoration.  They did a complete engine rebuild, turbo charger upgrade, roof rack installation, OME springs, powder coated factory rims, installed a front bumper, welded a custom rear bumper, and tons of NAPA service parts bringing this 21 year old SUV back to life.  They are a first class automotive service and repair company with talented techs and ownership that can fix your daily driver or build your one of kind custom builds.  Great work, exceptional service, at a fair price.

name: Scott Jackson
text: I stumbled across TAPCO on youtube while finding out what was involved in swapping the body mounts out on my F250. Along with body mounts, my truck needed new wheel hub assemblies and just someone to go over the steering issues i've had for some time, that several shops have looked at and never been able to diagnose. They were able to swap everything out and found a few things I was not aware of were contributing to the slack in my steering. The combination of fixed steering issues and the S&B body mounts, my 240k mile F250 feels like its a 40k mile truck! TAPCO gave great service, communication, and very fair rates for the amount of work done. Would highly recommend them!

resp.text: Appreciate the kind words Scott! We hope your truck is riding great!!

name: Ritesh Sevalkar
text: The service was quick and my car issue was resolved. I am satisfied with the place and would recommend it.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Max Hibbard
text: Been going for there for years now and they've never let me down. Reasonable pricing and they care about the work. Always get the job done well

resp.text: Thank you Max! Always a pleasure!

name: Arthur Tillman
text: I went in to get my vehicle fixed. I normally work on my car myself, but am willing to pay others to do so when problems are above my experience. I asked them to fix whatever it was that made the check engine light be on, which I knew was something with the vacuum system. I also asked them to fix two windows that weren’t working. They “fixed” my car and gave it back to me. Well on my drive home, I discovered a rat chewed halfway through my seat belt and left dropping in the floorboard that they did not clean up. The next day I let them know when I got off work and they said to bring it in and they would fix it. And they did, but they replaced my seatbelt with a black one and my interior is grey. When they replaced my window regulators, they left metal chips from drilling all in my carpet and leather interior, so they did not do a clean job and did not clean up after themselves. ALSO, my check engine light came back on and was running the same codes as it was before I brought it to them. So then I had to leave it with them for several more days. They had my car for over one week. One last thing is that my driver window was tight before they serviced it and made no road noise. Now, it leaks air over fifty and I don’t want to have to bring the car back to them for a third time. That same door now makes an awful rattling noise when it shuts, which it also did not do before they touched my car. I have had pleasant experiences with them in the past, and I left reviews those times as well but service was not what it use to be this visit.

resp.text:
Arthur,
Sorry to hear about your displeasure with our work. Lets start from the top. The vehicle was brought in after you personally attempted to repair many issues with the vehicle yourself and admitted that you may have done something wrong as everything you had done has still not fixed it and the same check engine lights remain on and the vehicle was running rough, even after you worked on it personally. We used our extensive diagnostic equipment and found multiple leaks throughout your vehicles intake system. I personally called and told you we had found these leaks and would need to take off the intake manifold you just put on yourself to see what was going on under it, as that is where the main leak was. I also notified you that there was an code in your ecu for the EGR system and that it may be triggered by the massive intake leak and we would need to correct the major leak first, and let you drive the vehicle to see if there was still an issue with the EGR system. The EGR Valve was also covered with epoxy from what looked to be a band aid repair from a previous time. This could be an issue, but during the diagnosis we did check each component of the system and did confirm the actuators and the valves were operating as they should.  Once we had your approval for the work, we moved forward. Once the intake manifold was removed, we found that you had left the old intake gaskets on the engine and also used the new gaskets of the intake manifold you just replaced. This is what we call being "double gasketed" and quickly saw this was the issue with the massive intake leak. We purchased new intake gaskets since the new ones you installed were severely damaged. We removed the old gaskets and cleaned the surface to ensure proper sealing on installation. Everything went together very smooth on the install and a quick smoke test found that the leak was no longer and the issue was repaired. The codes were cleared and the vehicle was test driven and confirmed that the vehicle was running properly and no longer had any further codes in the system. You were called and told the good news and were made aware that the EGR valve was still in question but would need significant miles put on it to be addressed. Once you took the vehicle and drove it, the light came back on and when you brought it back in we found that the same EGR code was back and found that the EGR Valve that you epoxied was blocking the air passage and triggering the light. You were not charged any further diagnosis and we repaired the EGR valve and there was no further issue.

After these issues were handled you requested that we look at your windows. The window regulators were found to be the issue at hand and they are riveted in from the factory and are very difficult to perfect. We Use OEM ford rivets and installed them to perfection with the factory holes in the door that were not modified in any way shape or form. I do apologize there is wind noise with the window now, we would be glad to take care of this issue and resolve it for you at no cost.  I was also not aware of the pieces in the floor that were claimed to be left by us, and I sincerely apologize for the possible mess left behind. I would be glad to provide a complimentary vacuum of your interior from a detail shop of your choosing. There was a good bit of mess on the floor, including crumbs and such, so we may of overlooked what mess we made, versus what mess was there before we began our work.

The seatbelt issue. We have never had a rat issue before at this location. We have been here for 8 years and never once faced an issue of the sort. We have biweekly pest control services done and stay very proactive with pest control due to the known issues of old downtown buildings and sewer systems. When brought to our concern, we replaced your belt with an OEM Ford part and purchased it by your VIN number at no cost. The interior in your vehicle was sun faded and that is why there is a color difference.

name: Kevin Sandlin
text: Don't go here. They charged my daughter $100 to tell her that her check engine light meant her gas cap was loose. If they'll take advantage of a 19 y/o girl who's out of state, what else do you think they'll do? Seriously: $100 to read a check engine light code and (literally) tighten a gas cap. #epicfail

resp.text: Kevin, I believe you may not fully understand the process of diagnosis on a vehicle. We take pride in our diagnosis and ensure the diagnosis is correct before we tell a customer any type of estimate. Our standard diagnostic rate is $100 and we roll that fee into the repair if you decided to do the repair with us. We have signage throughout the main office with this verbiage and discuss the process with customers as they drop a vehicle off. But yes, lets walk through it so you and everyone can understand. First, we read that check engine light on the vehicle, and used the $6500.00 computer scanner to do so. We went through and found every lasting detail on the issue down to the date it happened and how often it happened. That is where Autozone stops. They get their $30 scan tool out and tell you 10 guesses of items it could be. So now that we have a lot of data, and approved $100 of diagnostic work on the vehicle ( up to 1 hour of diagnosis ) we can move forward and start using our years of training and knowledge to properly diagnose your vehicle. Now my technician gets out his smoke machine (a $1600 tool)  that pressurizes your daughters Evap Emissions system and also fills the system with smoke so we can determine if there is a leak on the system. Then we put the vehicle on our $4500 lift to ensure that we inspect every inch of the system that has a fault. We also use the scanner in the above mentioned process to activate all of the solenoids of the evap system to ensure they are working properly and letting the system properly work. So now that we have used our multi thousand dollars in tools and years of knowledge that is priceless, we have determined your daughters system is actually in perfectly working condition and the only fault is that a personal mistake happened of someone leaving the gas cap loose! Whew! Seems like quite a lot for such a simple task, right?  Well what if you went by the local auto parts store, got a free scan on the vehicle and they sold you an evap canister for your daughters vehicle and then you take it somewhere for an install and spend $1000.00 and the same problem remains. I am sure this review would look a lot different if you took into consideration the time, the effort, the knowledge, and the care that was put into your 19 year olds daughter vehicle to ensure we did not sell her any parts or service she did not need and made sure she was getting the most honest and best value possible when she put her trust in our shop. I apologize you feel like we took advantage of her. I hope that you see we spent a careful amount of time ensuring we had a proper diagnosis, and realize that doing so does not come free. This business is how we feed our families and have done so for 8 years. If we did not charge customers for diagnosis, then we would become a charity, and likely go out of business, and your daughter would be stuck down the street at the dishonest shop that sold her thousands in repair work that was not needed. I am certainly glad to hear your daughters vehicle is still doing well and the check engine light has not come back on after our thorough diagnosis, with out costing her any extra money.  If you would like to further discuss this issue you are welcome to call me, Michael Lee, the owner whenever you would like to. I would be glad to walk you through our process and make sure you fully understand the extent of work we did ensuring your daughters vehicle was safe and properly diagnosed and why the $100.00 was charged. Most would consider it an #epicsave , you know, since we were the honest shop that did not take advantage of her and took every possible step to make sure her vehicle was diagnosed properly. Happy Holidays.

This was my first time using TAPCO.

They answered all of my questions, were very friendly, & lived up to all their outstanding reviews. I plan to use them for my needs in the future!
Thanks TAPCO

Took good care of my unlucky STI...

text: Outstanding job! 1st time having work done at this shop on my FJ Cruiser. Best experience with a repair shop in Birmingham! Very fast and really nice staff. I will definitely be back for all my car repair needs!

name: jenn virciglio
text: I highly recommend TAPCO! Great service! Jeremy and Michael and the guys do great work and are very reasonable on pricing. Don't waste your time going somewhere else!

name: william powell
text:
One Word for this place "HONEST"
Great Customer Service, Friendly.
Did I say HONEST well they are .I'm A 1st. time customer had a problem with BMW 535i was told by another shop I needed a battery for the car.
TAPCO told me I needed a battery for my remote . Keyless remote battery from Wal-mart $2.75 Car battery from other shop $300.00 . GUESS what it was "the remote." They could have told me yelp you need the $300.00 battery but they didn't. Also had a check engine light on, they checked that , cleared the data. Saying that the remote caused the entrees. Did I say HONEST well they are. Again with all the data on the check engine light they could've had my car in their shop for a month with a bill that would put in the poor house. But No being HONEST told me to watch the car and replace my remote battery.
Honestly the Best Place I've taken any car. Tell Jeremy I said Thanks !

I found them from good Google reviews, so I'll leave a good Google review. 5 stars.

name: Shirrell Moore
text: I will never take my truck or car there again,I took my SUV in because the brakes kept going to the floor,when I brought it to them the assured me that they can fix it,after he called me and told me it was ready to be picked up the brakes went slap to the floor so I left it with them 2 weeks then he called and asked me why I didn't tell him I put a brake booster on it I told him I didn't know what was put on there then he charge me again to put a brake booster on there,now he already put a master cylinder the first time that was the first thing he said was wrong with it but it wasn't the problem and I paid him 324.00 the second time 370.00 when he put the brake booster on it went up long enough to get it home when I got back in town I went to drive it coming off the interstate the brakes went slap out when I took it back to him on Monday morning trying to get him to fix it or give my money back he told me my godbrother sign a no warranty,but I told him he didn't suppose to let no body sign nothing if his name wasn't on it,I asked him to contact me cause when I first took it to Tapco I sign a warranty for 12 months or 12 000 miles but since it wasn't fixed properly he didn't want to honor the warranty he originally gave me now I'm out 700.00 and my brakes are the same when I first came I really feel robbed without a weapon, but I'mspeaking with my attorney!

resp.text:
It is unfortunate that you would not tell the entire truth here and try and lie for personal gain. Your vehicle left with working brakes and came back 3 times with working brakes. (Video Evidence) Your brother inspected, test drove, and then
signed off on the vehicle being repaired and working properly, and agreeing to the no warranty (mainly because you brought us used parts to install on your vehicle). This is all after the lies that were told about the vehicle and trying to throw us under the bus after multiple shops had unsuccessfully repaired your vehicle. I hope you are leaving the other shops that worked on your vehicle bad reviews and threatening them with attorneys as well, after all, they could not even repair your vehicle.  Before we even installed parts on the vehicle you threatened attorneys for some reason. We should of turned you away then, instead we repaired vehicle properly.  I am sorry you are so upset. We do not turn out incomplete work. Our endless reviews on here and Facebook, and your brother signing off on our work after a thorough inspection are proof to my statement.

Also, NAPA Autocare provides a nationwide warranty for our customers. I would recommend calling another NAPA Autocare center in the area that will accept your business. I ask that you treat them with respect and be up front with them from the beginning and don’t threaten their every move with lawsuits.

It is unfortunate that Google will not let businesses review customers.

I will gladly accept your 1 star review. Thank you!

name: Joshua Gilley

name: Nic Salyers
text:
Work was done quickly and well, and at a reasonable price. The crew went above and beyond to take care of me and my jeep, and put up with my constant need for updates. Will definitely use again.

*Six(ish) month update*: I pulled into Tapco this morning and asked them to just listen to my engine since it's a jeep and always has some weird sound. Jeremy immediately went out, diagnosed the (non)issue from sound alone, and off I went. In and out in 5 minutes and now I've got peace of mind. Still a solid 5 star review from me.

name: J Chris Mason
text: Reliable people you can trust in the car repair & maintenance business.

text: I had a fantastic experience with Tapco. The particular vehicle issues I was dealing were complicated and stressful but Tapco made everything easy and hassle-free. Additionally, they did not push me to fix or change anything I was not ready to do and spent time discussing the pros and cons of fixing or not fixing a part. They went out of their way to test drive my car after fixing the starter to ensure it ran correctly and went above and beyond to contact Honda to find my radio code. The employees at Tapco made this a painless and pleasant experience. I trust them completely and can honestly say they are the only auto company I will deal with again.

name: Cyndie Downer
text: My husband had his truck windows tinted here. They are 40 minutes from where we live, but highly recommended by a friend. Great experience, it was quick, under an hour and it looked great. So we schedule my car for the 1st available appt., a couple of months away. No problem. My husband wasn't able to pay deposit over the phone that day - somekind of trouble with payment system. Female told my husband no problem, we were a repeat customer. Morning of 1 pm appointment I call to confirm time only to find my appointment had been cancelled because a deposit wasn't paid and they had already scheduled another for that time slot. She said he (her husband?) tried contacting me the day before but I had just swapped to a new phone -and my voice mail wasn't set up yet. Next available appt.was in May. I just tell her I'll reschedule, or find another place to have it done. She offered to call if there was a cancellation.  My husband calls them and reminds her that she said the deposit issue was okay. She admits she didn't make a note of it and they can get me in. I take my lunch hour and an extra hour (or so) off from work, drive 40 minutes one way, then when I say I'll just wait while it's being done, he says that it will take 3-4 hours for my sedan. I based my timeline on our previous experience (<1 hour) and we were NOT told on any of the three phone calls leading up to the appointment to expect a 3-4 hour window! They even knew I was driving from 40 minutes away. I am not bashing this business, I am just sharing my experience. You can call this a series of mis-communications and odd events but I call it just poor customer service. We will never do business here again.

resp.text: I'm very sorry for the mix up and your disappointing  experience during your visit.  We tried very hard to accommodate you and were very thankful to the customer who allowed us to open your spot back up. We did not realize that you were expecting your car to be done in the same amount of time as the smaller job we did on your husband's truck. This was a series of unfortunate events for both of us. I hope that you were able to get your sedan tinted and all went well.

But then I few months after they installed my music it all started going out one speaker at a time until the point where no sound at all was coming out. So after that I decided to take matters into my own hands because I used to install music myself years ago. upon removing the panels from my doors an getting to the back of the speakers it was obvious that the wiring used on my speakers was very cheap because it had already dry rotted after a few months. I was able to get all my speakers back working again but then a few months after that they're already going back out only two of the speakers are working. so all-in-all I am not too happy about the job that was done on my vehicle.

Unless we're installing an amplifier or have reason to suspect that there is an issue with the wiring we just use the factory wire that's in the vehicle.
