name: Donnie Coleman
text:
Filed on : January 30 2014

Filed by :
Donald Coleman
359 South Montcrest
Cullman AL 35057

Filed against :
Stewart Auto Supply, Inc.
1211 Loring Nw
Cullman AL 35055

Complaint Description:
worst machine work i have seen in my life ,and the machinist is rude and not willing to make things right. Took my 6.0 LQ4 block, crank and heads to have them reworked, cleaned and check to see if they were still within spec limits. We discussed engine gaskets rebuild kits. I left and then called on the phone to discuss more pricing and gaskets again. I went back to stewarts to bring some more parts to be cleaned but on that visit talked again about rebuild kits and gaskets. Now each time i talked to the owner about the gasket sets i asked, were they felpro? his answer every time was yes they will be felpro. He gave me a price which was little more then what i had search online for but i decided to go with his kit since the gaskets were definitely felpro . well is snowed the next day and roads were closed so i had to wait another day for him to finish. roads were still bad so he came in late but he was finished around lunch time. So when i get there to pick up my parts i ask where is the rebuild kit. The machinist shows me the box and the gaskets sets are not felpro, they are Victor reins gaskets. I refused to buy the kit because he told me a they would contain felpro. The machinist told me that felpro and victor reins were made by the same company that they were the exact same gaskets. That was his first lie too me. Those are two entirely different companys, with different pricing and materials. so we deducted the kit and now i owe for the machine work done, which is 345.00 I pay the balance go home and start unloading the block and notice the cam bearing that they installed for me were damaged from the installation too. Took it back and the owner said he doesn't know any other way to put those bearings in. well duh!!! but you don't damage them when they go in , if you do damage them then you take them out and install new ones. but they sent me home with that crap. so i decided to look over the heads real good since things are already not good. well the heads are aluminum heads , they look as if someone took a wire brush to clean the mating surfaces on the heads. they are scratched badly. there are several scratches going across the from one cylinder to the other which will leak when it is installed back on the block. So i took the heads back to stewarts this morning and asked to talk to someone about this and the owner wasn't there but the machinist was. so i showed the head to the machinist and asked what he did to it. he said he milled it. i asked is that acceptable? he said yes. i asked if he could show me any where in writing, online or any mechanic that can tell me that those scratches on the mating surface of the head was acceptable .The machinist looked at me and said pick my head up and get the hell out of there. You can imagine what my response was. :) but I'm not happy with this and the place of business is just horrible. I have been building engines for over 23 years and i have never seen anyone tell me that scratches on a aluminum head was acceptable to install. They refused to take of this and now i have to take the heads and have them resurfaced if they can even be resurfaced again. i also heve to take the block and crank to another machine shop to have them check and correct everything stewarts touched. BEWARE SHOTTY WORK AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. STAY AWAY if you want good work performed.

Your Desired Resolution:
At this point all i want is a complete refund for the services they performed. I tried to go back to talk to them and i was told to get the hell out of their store. The work performed was bad and i don't fell comfortable letting them touch anything else of mine.

text: The salesman greeted me promptly said hello he smiled and asked me what he could do to help me. I mentioned that I had called about a battery for my 92 Toyota Paseo. The salesman looked on the shelves on the floor and then said politely that he would have to search for the battery in the back stockroom. He promptly returned from the back of the store with the battery and completed the transaction. The salesman even helped carry the new battery to my vehicle. I am a fan of Chase Elliott in NASCAR. As I was about to leave the salesman said to wait a minute and walked back into the store. A few minutes later the salesman came back out of the store and hands me a NAPA Racing hat with Chase Elliott's number on it and a replica of his autograph also. I asked him how much I owed for the hat and he said that I didn't owe anything for it since I was a fan of Chase Elliott. I will be using Dutton Auto Parts i.e. Napa for all of my auto parts needs in the near future.

name: Adam Benson
text: To bree k. On your story about what took place. The vehicle in question was brought in because the ignition switch was defective. Due to the connector going to the anti-theft module was not making connection. After I spent 30 minutes on the phone with the chevy dealer I found the connector was not available. I instructed your daughter to go and get a complete unit with a new pig tail. After explaining to them that a code reading would bring no results to identify the issue. I did allow the vehicle to sit in my parking lot until the problem could be addressed. Most places charge several hundred dollars to do this. Several days later they brought in a switch from a junk yard that was ripped out and badly damaged. I told them they could not use part due to being damaged. After a couple days a night time worker offered to help with diagnostics, he brought his scan tool and tried to diagnosis the issue. Found the anti-theft module was not making any connection with the vehicles pcm. He spent over an hour trying to help your daughter for free. He normally charges $70 an hour for this. We have gone out of our way to help your daughter every way we could. Including letting the vehicle sit for over a week. No way did your stand out in the cold while we laughed at her. If you feel we miss treated you I am the store manager my name is Adam Benson and feel free to come by and we can discuss this situation.

I stopped at this store to see if they could help me out and what I got was NOTHING.  I didn't expect them to fix it or even look at it.  I just needed some direction and what I got was a "we can't help you".  I went down the street to NAPA auto parts where the guy working in there checked my fuse for me and replaced it for me.  Advance needs to take some customer service lessons from NAPA.
I very rarely write negative reviews for retail businesses because I worked in retail management for years and I understand that things happen but this was beyond rude and I will always use NAPA going forward.

name: Archduke Bacon Von Cheeseburger
text: Got a Bed liner sprayed in and the bed liner looks great, but the Scratches and chips and gouges in my paint job do not. Update (3-19-18) - When I picked up the truck from commercial van it was very dirty and there were little pieces of bed-liner plastic stuck all over the truck. It looked like over-spray, but they came off when I wiped them, thinking that this wouldn't be a problem I took the truck home (that was my big mistake). I didn't notice the paint chips until after I went home and washed all the little pieces of over-spray plastic off. There are 2 chips next to the drivers side Z71 emblem a gouge in the clear coat right above the drivers side tail light and 2 large chips in the clear coat between the bed and cab on the passengers side. All of these are in the immediate area around where they were working.  I also found a scuff where something rubbery with grit on it was dragged across my passenger rear door and had to use buffing compound to get it off. If you have work done there you need to stay and watch them, because as with any auto shop damage done will never be "their" fault.  Troy the owner called me this morning and asked if I was the one that wrote the bad review of his business. When I told him yes I wrote it he said that review is unnecessary and that I had planned to scam him from the start. When I got tired of listening to his accusations I hung up on him. He then calls me back and leaves a message telling me I was extremely unprofessional and I was no longer welcome at his business. As the owner of a business that relies on good experiences with customers it is HIS job to be the professional. And the professional thing to do would have been to ask me to bring it back so they could look at the damage instead of accusing me of being a scammer. All I was going to ask for was some touch up paint so I could fix it myself, but all I got was hostility and accusations. My father is going to get a bed-liner done on his truck, but he will not be using Commercial Van Specialists in Loxley. Troy and his "business" will never get another dime of my money, nor will they get any business from any of my family and friends.  When I give someone money to work on my vehicle I expect them to treat it and me with respect, but these people fall terribly terribly short.

text: Never really understood what truck outfitting is. That is, until I bought an old used pickup. There's things you need to do to it to tailor it to your uses, that's where these fine people come in. I've added a bed mat, a tonneau cover and step bars. Put them on one at a time, as I realized what I needed. I was treated as if I come in with a new Ford F-350 even though it was just an old Titan. Thanks guys, my truck fits my needs now! Would recommend this organization to everybody!

name: Captain Stehle
text: They do very professional work here.  The staff is knowledgeable and friendly.  Price are consistent unlike some places you will visit.  They treat women just as fairly as men which also unlike some other places in the auto industry.  There linex service is unmatched.  They are slightly higher on prices, but for the quality of workmanship and service it is worth a few extra dollars.  They stand behind there work 100%.

Found at cheaper $ and matched same lower price for the one he sold me! Incredible! He also gapped new plugs & provided a firing order diagram. Helped get a very rough running tow vehicle back to cruising while family enjoyed a local lunch! THANK YOU KYLE!! Surprised no prev reviews. This place was a true blessing of gracious hospitality!

text: I was very impressed by the dedication of the staff. I took my Toyota Tacoma truck by to have them add the electrical plug for my trailer hitch. They went over it and said there were two types. They ordered one, but when it came in, it wasn’t the right one. I was very impressed by their honesty in telling me the truth. They apologized and said they would be glad to get the right one if I would allow them. While they were evaluating it though, they discovered that the trailer hitch was not properly mounted. I watched them fix it, and they didn’t charge me for fixing it. They installed the right one the next day and I was very satisfied. Thanks Clint and crew.

name: Wesley Hall
text: I am highly disappointed with H and H as a whole... I called and set up an appointment through corporate to have a hitch and wiring harness installed on our Jeep Oatriot. The gadsden store was closest to me. Christian tried to set me up an 8:00 a:m appt. but I could not make it so he set me up for 10:30 a:m.... I clarified that these items were in stock at the store. He said yes they are... so I call this morning at 8:30 a:m this morning to verify my appt... I get a call at 9:30 telling me that oops, we don’t have your parts here and are waiting on them to come in on our truck!!! They should be here about 11:30 or so!!!!!!!!!! I took of work  for half a day to have this installed... now it’s gonna cost me a whole day... why make an appt if this is how you are treated? It’s crazy and very frustrating!!! As well as costly....to lose a whole day of work

resp.text: Wesley, we do sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. H&H has discounted your purchase and hopes you will give us another chance in the future!

name: Trevor Joiner
text: Advance Auto is my go-to store for all things automotive. Tonight, I visited not for automotive needs but guitar needs. I'm a luthier (I build, repair, and restore guitars) and tonight I needed a fine polish to restore the gloss to the lacquer of an old 70s guitar. They didn't have what I was looking for (Meguire's Mirror Glaze #9) but the guy was super, super helpful and friendly. The friendly service, competitive prices, and amazing savings when using coupons for online purchases are why I will come to Advance again and again.

text: I ordered online and went inside for pickup. All the workers were polite and helpful. I didn't have to wait long to get what I had order, and they even help me find a tool I wasn't able to find on the website!

name: Michaela Carter
text: I went in to get an oil filter for my car and told them exactly what I needed. Well the lady rang up the wrong filter and I didn’t recognize it til I paid and picked up the bag and it was way to heavy. I told her that was the wrong one we got it corrected. I paid almost $18 for that and I knew the one I normally get is only around $10-11. So she gets the receipt and is scanning it to refund the difference and i thought it was completed so as I am walking out I check the receipt and nothing was refunded. I go to the back double check the pricing before saying anything went to the front to advise her there was nothing refunded. She proceeded to tell me that I seemed to be in a hurry so she was going to let me go ahead and go but in order to refund the difference I had to swipe my card again. So if you have anything with a price difference to be refunded make sure it actually happens and you get the receipt.

resp.text: Michaela, we apologize for the lack of attention regarding your whole visit to our Muscle Shoals location. Your feedback has been forwarded to the Field Leadership team of this store and they will address any additional training that may be needed. When you come in with exact details of what you want, that should be what you get. We hope that that you do give the store another chance in the future to provide you the proper experience. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts.

resp.text: Hello Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave this review! Here at Advance, we aim to provide exceptional service to all of our customers, and we're sorry to learn that your visit to our Muscle Shoals location resulted in a 1 star rating. Unfortunately, we cannot offer installation of headlight bulbs, however we do provide this service for wiper blades. We did make contact with this store, and unfortunately they were unfamiliar with this incident. We certainly apologize for any inconveniences this may have caused you, and hope for another opportunity to earn your business. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts and Batteries, we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Rick
text: There are several things that make this place the best.  I write this review after driving an hour and a half to do business with them.  First off all, they do more than trucks.  30 inch rims for your car they do it, headlights, taillights, lifts, flares, tonneau covers, etc... if you want it they can get it.  There prices are hard to beat.  But let me talk about what sets them apart from everyone besides their exceptional pricing.  From the moment you walk in you are treated with respect and that they are glad to see you there.  They listen very intently to what you want whether in person or on the phone.  This is missed by so many other places.  They go through getting prices as well as can show you options.  They do this to make sure you get exactly what you want for the best price.  While doing so they take notes on the conversation to ensure they don't have to ask you several times because they forgot.  Making sure they stay on top of it and making everything move flawless.  The business is very well maintained and the showroom is definitely a showroom, not just a display, spotless.  Respect and honesty is projected so loudly by the staff, you will feel like its your own family that runs the business.  I can't say enough about this because I have been there a few times for different purchases and  the entire staff is friendly as well as great to interact with.  As I return to them next week to make another purchase, driving an hour and a half versus using the internet, I know I am meeting people who are like family, getting the best price, the right part, quality parts, but also the best service that I have seen in the state.

name: Mike Lowery (challenges)
text: I'm the VP for the Buckhorn High School football quarterback club and we had a flat tire on our equipment trailor that we had brought to our game versus Cullman High School.  The staff at Cullman High referred us to Branham.  They stayed open late to replace our tire so we could make it back to Huntsville.  They are wonderful people that care about their community and will go above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service! I would recommend Branham for any automotive needs you may have. He further advised that he believed a Chevy dealership would need to look into it, as it I was probably computer related. This is how a business should operate. They have won my business forever and I recommend them to anyone reading this. Bravo! Thank you!

name: KJ MullinZ
text:
🔥Workers involved:
MIKE (Store Manager)
THOMAS D. (Employee)
Date of incident: 2/20/21 - 4:30-5:00pm.

🔥Bought a refurbished starter from there a few years ago. Returned it because it went bad and had a warranty. Did not want to deal with another refurbished starter, so I requested a brand new one. Was told they cannot get a brand new one which is fine. So they told me I could return the defective refurbished starter I had for a refund so I can use that refund on buying a new starter from another store. At that time, that particular employee was real helpful and kind to me.

Then the incident on 2/20/21 happened when I returned on that date with my defective starter. was dealing with the store manager Mike and his employee Thomas D. at the time. I was told that the starter needed to test bad in order for me to get a refund which is fine, because I had my mechanic test the starter beforehand and I recorded a video as evidence. After waiting a good few minutes because it seemed like something was wrong with the machine, the store manager Mike comes out and says that the starter tested good, but that he would still honor the refund. I told him that's fine, but the starter should have tested bad because my mechanic already tested it and I watched him test it, so I pretty much told Mike that the machine is to blame, then he got defensive and rude with his tone of voice about the machine clearly stating that the machine was not incorrect. To avoid further debating, I directly said to just do the refund. His attitude regarding the situation was unprofessional and unacceptable.

What makes the situation even worse is the fact that the employee Thomas D. asked me for my driver's license on returning the defective starter which should not have happened, because I have my receipt. When I asked him why he's asking for my driver's license, he said they were supposed to do that on returns, but that's obviously not true. Something didn't feel right, so I called another advance Auto parts store about the situation and that store told me that advance auto of Enterprise were in the wrong for taking my driver's license. My driver's license has the address to my Mother's home because it's an old address and I am not comfortable with that address being on file because I'm protective of my mother and concerned for her safety. I do not trust people I don't know, and I definitely do not trust that advance Auto parts store anymore and ever again.

They acted very shady and I felt discriminated because I'm part Asian. I've been shopping there off and on for years for myself and for my Mother. As of now, I am no longer a customer and I want my information out of that system immediately. Yes, I got my refund, but I shouldn't have had to go through that much trouble to get it, or feel that uncomfortable. Everything that happened that day was pretty much recorded on my phone along with two eyewitnesses that were with me in case I need them for future reference.

resp.text: Hello KJ, thank you for leaving your comments about your visit to our Enterprise location. We have forwarded your concerns to the store leadership and apologize for the experience you had. In no way does Advance Auto condone discrimination and we will be investigating the allegations. Please feel free to reach out to our customer service department at 877-238-2623 to provide any more information and thank you for choosing Advance Auto.

(Translated by Google) Linda, thank you for submitting your review of our business location. We are sorry you did not have a good customer experience due to the team members at this store. We strive to ensure that all team members are informed and willing to help when assisting customers with parts and inventory needs and we apologize that the store did not meet this goal. At this time, we have sent this information to our Leadership Team and we assure you that they will use this review to improve all services in the store. We hope you give the store another opportunity to serve your automotive needs.

text:
The guys at Jimmy's are fantastic - I didn't want a fancy setup or any crazy speakers/subwoofers - I was just looking for a subtle smartphone enabled stereo for an 08 Acura.

They gave me the range of options available without being pushy to get me to buy some extravagant device. They knew my goal and helped me find an audio system that matched.

Ultimately, they did an outstanding job at installing a subtle double din Sony XAV AX5000. The integration looks OEM and the backup camera is extremely subtle with a crystal clear image. I was really worried about an aftermarket setup looking tacky, but these guys did a very professional job.

Highly recommend the team at Jimmy's. (before and after pics posted, along with the backup camera)

name: Kevin Wall
text:
These are the guys to use for all your car and marine stereo needs!!!!

Long story short: The marina that the Cobalt is stored at forces you to use their vendor. After a simple upgrade from factory set up I had multiple issues with the stereo system.

Took to the original marina I purchased the boat from to fix. Returned with a bill and bunch of excuses and no fix just a misdiagnosis.

Called the team from Jimmy's to sort out. They accommodated a time that worked for me to bring the boat in.

In a few short minutes had an initial diagnosis. Three short hours later they had fixed all issues and made the system work exactly as designed.

Extremely reasonable charge to perform the work!

If you need a stereo upgrade for your boat go here first!

If you are stuck at a marina with no way to get to them, talk to your marina manager to let the team at Jimmy's come to your boat. You'll be glad you did!

See you on the water!

name: Leonard Hall
text:
I tried, on many occasions, to support this business. I went here in June and spoke with Ben about correcting an issue that was caused at another car audio place.

Ben assured me that it would be an easy fix and told me to come by the following week. I called one day that next week and Ben said that they were too busy on that particular day. I asked if I could just make an appointment instead. Ben said, “Well, I’m kinda tied up right now. Try us again later this week.”

I was in the area the following week so I went by. After greeting me, Ben remembered me and immediately told me that they couldn’t get to my car that day. I told him that I wasn’t expecting a same-day service. I, instead, wanted to make an appointment. Ben thanked me for coming by and told me that the shop had been so busy.

He, again, assured me that the shop could easily correct the problem. He went on to say, “It’s really a five-minute fix. I could do it now, but I don’t want to just in case something happens and makes it longer than that and throw our day off.”

My appointment was set for Wednesday, July 8th at 9:30am. I used PTO at work so that I could finally get the issue taken care of. The evening before my appointment, Ben called and told me they would have to cancel (not reschedule) my appointment because they didn’t get a chance to finish a car from the previous day. He went on to say that they could probably do it at “some other time” and he’d call me to let me know when. Of course, I was never called.

•Why would you tell your customer that you’re too busy to give them an appointment? Especially when there are others working in the office.

•Why are you making the customer chase you as if this is the only place that could correct the issue?

•I understand that the shop may have been busy, or behind schedule. Why not reschedule my appointment?

•If you did not want to (or could not) perform the work, you should’ve been upfront. It was a waste of both of our time.

This is the second Jimmy’s Car Stereo location I’ve had a poor experience at.

name: Tony Craig
text: These guys looked out for me big time especially for this to be my first built everything turned out great and will definitely see me again soon..For them understanding I'ma college student but wanted to go all out my first built they kept me in a great price range and very affordable and can't thank them enough

text: I’m had some work done a couple years ago and it has been great so far. My only gripe is how tight they tightened my positive battery terminal. Long story short, in my attempt to remove the battery, I stripped the terminal and grounded out my wrench simultaneously which caused more problems with the wiring that I had to pay a mechanic to fix. All of this could have been easily avoided if they wouldn’t have tightened it SO TIGHT! Completely unnecessary, especially considering how close the fuse box and the battery are put together which already makes it hard enough to losen. I would have rather used that money I spent on a mechanic at Jimmy’s getting more audio equipment because they have great stuff.

name: Jon Bernreuter
text:
I have a 1980 Oldsmobile Cutlass, and these guys really suck at this car. Years ago, I told the cashier I had a Cutlass, and he asked me what the make was. I told him, "Dude, it's a Cutlass. It's an Oldsmobile." His response to me was, and I'm dead serious, "Sorry man, cars aren't really my thing.”

Back in February, I needed a new alternator. Super simple, easy to find part, never had any trouble getting one for this car. Round one, the one they sold me was clocked wrong. We tried to clock it ourselves, because my car was immobilized 1hr 30min away and I didn't want drive to the nearest NAPA to return it. Well we took it apart wrong and broke all the wires.

I took it back and explained what happened. They told me they couldn't do a warranty swap because I broke it. Which I'm sure is technically correct, but also a really bad way to handle it since the part they sold me was wrong, and I had the old one when they sold it to me. Two separate cashiers looked at the old one and the new one side by side and sold it to me anyway.

I just bought a new one instead of fighting it for round 2. The guy that sold me the second one accidentally just gave it to me, assuming it was a warranty replacement, AND refunded me on my card, so I actually made money on this transaction. Which is a good thing because this one immediately whined because it had bad bushings straight out of the box.

Round 3, I gave up and gave an auto shop a ton of money to buy one from a specialty shop already clocked and install it for me, because a 15 minute home repair was taking a week.

A week or so, another shop thought they discovered a radiator leak (I later found out the top hose was just loose and spraying coolant, so this is all really ironic). I went back to NAPA and asked for advice. Fatal mistake.
One of the guys, and he's super nice but dumb as a box of rocks when it comes to cars, sold me some Radiator Stop Leak. I also bought some other radiator additive that supposedly helps rejuvenate the o-rings or something. Not sure how that is possible for something that doesn't actually go inside the cylinders, but this guy works at NAPA so I'm sure he's got this.

He tells me I can dump both of them into the radiator and it will be fine. I follow his advice and read the instructions on the bottle. The system had just been flushed and filled, and the radiator and water pump are less than 5 years old. I let the car idle for 15 minutes and run the heater full blast.

I drive the car for 30 seconds and the hot light comes on, and the shift point for first gear has shifted up. I drive it to the shop and the guy immediately tells me I ruined my coolant system, and probably cooked the transmission, because Radiator Stop Leak is garbage and it does damage. They had to take the radiator out and all the hoses off and blow them out by hand, because the system was so clogged up they couldn't even flush it out with the radiator machine. It cost me $371.

So these $20 additives clogged up my cooling system to the tune of $371, and now I need a new transmission to the tune of $3,000. My car is parked because it will be at least 2 years before I can afford to fix it.

Radiator Stop Leak essentially laughed at me on Twitter, and I don't have the receipt anyway, AND NAPA DOES NOT ARCHIVE RECEIPTS. They have computers, but I guess they just don't save them on purpose. I can get an archived receipt from Guitar Center for a windscreen I bought in 2006.

Anyway, these employees are all super nice and they try to be helpful, but do not listen to them because they are all dumb as hell.

name: Jessica Howard
text: We were going down the highway near Birmingham and had a blowout on our motorhome,  we called Action Tire Co. And they had a tire for us delivered to them by the time we got to the shop. Then they had us fixed and secure and back on the road in no time. I gave this company 5 stars and I'd give them 10 if I could. Gil and Sam took care of us I feel so very blessed. If your in this area and need tires for your truck or motorhome this is the place to go!

resp.text: Jessica, having a blow out on the highway is never a fun experience, and we're glad you all were safe. It was our pleasure helping you out quickly, and it's great to hear Gil and Sam led the way the whole time. We hope you've been well over the last few months, and we'll be here if you're ever in the area and in need of our services. -The team at Action Tire Company - Birmingham

name: Cory Nabors
text: These guys are great! I have been using these guys for all my wheel and tire needs and they come through every time. Price, service, expertise, and quality that can't be beat. Call them now!

resp.text: Cory, making sure our customers wheels are in wheelie great shape is the name of the game here. It's awesome to know our team has come through for you any time you needed us, and we appreciate that you trust us to get the job done right every time. You know we'll continue to be here ready to tackle any other tire issues you might need help with whenever you need us. -The team at Action Tire Company - Birmingham

name: Mark Swearingen
text: Erased Last Post,  Because of a Miscommunication,  over the phone.  Monday 6/29/20, Started Off Bad, but at the End of the day,  Action Tire was There and came through,  and Even Discounted Them More then Original Price over the Phone., Thank You Action Tire.

resp.text: We apologize for the confusion with your tires, Mark. We understand how this could be frustrating for you, and we hope that we can get in touch soon and resolve everything. -The Team at Action Tire Company

name: Steven Dempsey
text: Great service, very professional and polite guys! Highly recommended!

resp.text: Steven, professionalism is our middle name! Thanks for choosing us to get your car back on the road safely, and we'll be here to help if you ever need a hand in the future. -The team at Action Tire Company - Birmingham

name: Mark Heath
text: 2 hours from home on I-65 I blow out a tire on the outskirts of Birmingham.  I find Action Tire on a Google search.    One hour later I have the tire of my choice installed right there in the emergency lane of I-65 for a reasonable price and I’m on my way!   Highly recommend!

name: Hunter Hill
text: Great guys and very polite. They made replacing the tires on our customers crane a breeze. I would recommend them to any one.

text: I was impressed with the friendly and knowledgeable staff. They had the tires I was looking for and answered every question I threw at them without batting an eye. This is the place to come if you are looking for commercial tires!
